### Channel Your Curiosity on Your Own Scientific Adventure

Enrich your learning about the most awe-inspiring milestones in the scientific world with hands-on experiences and multifaceted exhibits. Visit [Moonshot Museum](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/blog/moonshot-museum-pittsburgh-guide/) for out-of-this-world memories, watching the assembly of spacecraft and participating in simulated lunar missions. Discover a wide range of eureka-like moments at [Daniel G. and Carole L. Kamin Science Center](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/blog/insiders-guide-kamin-science-center/), wandering through a planetarium, a submarine, and a fitness area where you can transform into a human yo-yo. Younger audiences will relish exciting activities at [Children's Museum of Pittsburgh](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/childrens-museum-of-pittsburgh-and-museumlab/), where creativity is inspired by spots such as a waterplay area and a "Makeshop."

### Revisit Iconic Pittsburgh Sports Moments

Pittsburgh sports fans will be enthralled by [Steelers Hall of Honor Museum](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/blog/steelers-hall-of-honor-museum/), which commemorates the history of the team with rare memorabilia and celebrates 49 inductees. For a more eclectic spin on your museum outing, visit [Bicycle Heaven Museum](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/bicycle-heaven-museum/), embarking on an adventure through the world's biggest bike museum and store.

title: Fun Things to Do in Pittsburgh | Visit Pittsburgh
content:
# Things to Do

A City of Multitudes

Pittsburgh is a modern, ever-evolving city where the must-sees vary week to week as Downtown-encompassing [festivals](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/events-festivals/), a vibrant Cultural District of [world-class productions](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/arts-culture/), fan-friendly [sports events](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/pittsburgh-sports-teams/) in iconic stadiums, and our distinct [four seasons](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/plan-your-trip/weather/) make each trip unique. Add in our award-winning [culinary](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/restaurants-culinary/) scene, [craft beverage](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/restaurants-culinary/craft-breweries/)-packed neighborhoods and renowned [museums](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/arts-culture/museums/) you can enjoy throughout the year, and the only thing you won't have on your itinerary is free time.

Need to extend your trip a day or two to get it all in? [We figured](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/hotels-resorts/).

[Top Free Things to Do in Pittsburgh​Who said you have to spend money to have a good time?\\
Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/free-things-to-do/)

[Top 25 Things to Do in PittsburghWondering what there is to see in Pittsburgh? We’ve put together an extensive list of must-visit…\\
Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/blog/top-things-to-do/)

[Pittsburgh SportsIn Pittsburgh, we bleed black and gold.\\
Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/pittsburgh-sports-teams/)

[Family Fun\\
Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/family-fun/)

[Restaurants & CulinaryGlobal cuisine spanning 90 unique neighborhoods\\
Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/restaurants-culinary/)

[Pittsburgh Craft BreweriesCheers to a city that is full of craft beer culture.\\
Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/restaurants-culinary/craft-breweries/)

[Arts & CulturePittsburgh is a city of eclectic cultures, communities and neighborhoods that help create the vibrant arts…\\
Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/arts-culture/)

Inclines and trolleys and riverboats (oh my)! There are so many ways to [tour and sightsee](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/tours-sightseeing/) around the city of Pittsburgh.

You can take a [tour](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/tours-sightseeing/) by bike, trolley, boat, jet ski, kayak, funicular, bus or Segway, or go old fashioned and explore on your own two feet. Take a ride on the historic [Duquesne Incline](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/duquesne-incline/) for panoramic views of the city's skyline and rivers.

[Outdoor enthusiasts](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/) can hike, bike and picnic at the numerous [parks and green spaces](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/parks/), including [Schenley Park](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/schenley-park/) and [Point State Park](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/point-state-park/).

Our recommendation? Pick one of our [90 neighborhoods](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/neighborhoods/) that make the city unique and explore.

# Golf Courses in Pittsburgh

Pittsburgh boasts a rich golf history.

Pennsylvania boasts more than 500 [public golf courses](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/blog/top-pittsburgh-public-golf-courses/) with many of [Golf Digest's best ranked](http://www.golfdigest.com/story/pennsylvania-best-in-state-rankings) located in Pittsburgh. With highly awarded courses like Olde Stonewall and Nemacolin Resort's Mystic Rock, you'll enjoy championship play that is second to none.

## Public Golf Courses

### Quicksilver Golf Club

2000 Quicksilver Rd.

Midway, PA 15060

[724.796.1594](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.796.1594 "Call with Dialpad")

Experience Quicksilver Golf Club! A true championship course, beautiful new banquet facilities and affordable prices for the public only. Former home to Senior PGA and Nation Wide Tour events. The course is challenging, enjoyable and beautifully conditioned. Quicksilver is perfect for your regular foursomes or a golf outing and banquet.

### [North Park Golf Course](http://alleghenycounty.us/parks/activities/golf-courses.aspx)

10200 Kummer Road

Wexford, PA 15090

412.961.0512

This all-year challenging 18-hole layout just miles north of the city boasts a Pro Shop, practice range, blacktop cart paths, and café. The layout of the par 72 course offers an exciting round of golf for players of all skill levels.

### [South Park Golf Course](http://alleghenycounty.us/parks/activities/golf-courses.aspx)

E Park Drive

Pittsburgh, PA 15236

412.835.3545

This all-year challenging golf course includes a par 35 9-hole course and par 72 18-hole courses, shelter rental, snack shop, and blacktop cart paths. The beautiful greens are the perfect layout for all skill levels.

### [Oglebay Resort & Conference Center](http://www.oglebay-resort.com/index.html "Link to Oglebay golf website")

465 Lodge Drive

Wheeling, WV 26003

[877.436.1797](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=877.436.1797 "Call with Dialpad")

Oglebay is truly a golfer's paradise with four golf courses including two championship courses at the Speidel Golf Club! The newest championship course is a modern links layout designed by Arnold Palmer and is the perfect complement to our classic Robert Trent Jones, Sr. designed championship course. Oglebay also features the 18-hole regulation Crispin Course and a 9-hole Par III Course. Oglebay's courses will provide enough challenges and spectacular scenery to please the most discriminating golfer!

### [Hickory Heights Golf Club](http://www.hickoryheightsgolf.com/ "Hickory Heights Golf Club")

116 Hickory Dr.

Bridgeville, PA 15017

[412.257.0300](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412.257.0300 "Call with Dialpad")

Hickory Heights is a Michael Hurdzan-designed, 18-hole, high-end, daily-fee course that offers memberships. The course features challenging holes and breathtaking views. Grass-tee driving range, new club house and golf outing services add to the experience.

### [Olde Stonewall Golf Club](http://www.oldestonewall.com/ "Olde Stonewall Golf Club")

1495 Mercer Rd.

Ellwood City, PA 16177

[724.752.4653](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.752.4653 "Call with Dialpad") x103

Selected by Golf Magazine as one of the Top Ten new public courses in 1999 and currently ranked in the Top 50 public courses in the United States by Golf Digest, Olde Stonewall puts grandeur well within your reach. Located just forty minutes from Pittsburgh, Youngstown, Ohio and the Pittsburgh International Airport, this course is a golf experience long anticipated.

### [Cranberry Highlands Golf Club](http://www.cranberryhighlands.com/ "Cranberry Highlands Golf Club")

5601 Freshcorn Rd.

Cranberry Township, PA 16066

[724.776.7372](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.776.7372 "Call with Dialpad")

Cranberry Highlands celebrates the natural challenges of western Pennsylvania's rugged landscape with a stunning 186-acre course created to provide a high-quality test of golf for players at every level. Players will find Cranberry Highlands to be a readily walkable course, discretely linked by cart paths and ringed in the timberstock that defines the region.

### [Tanglewood Golf Course](http://www.tanglewoodgc.net/ "Tanglewood Golf Course")

318 Tanglewood Rd.

Pulaski, PA 16143

[724.964.8702](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.964.8702 "Call with Dialpad")

Clingan's Tanglewood started with the perfect blend of rolling hills and scenic wooded surroundings. Old trees and carved hillsides lend to spectacular views from all areas of the course. The distinct layout was developed naturally. The Clingans groomed this property into 18 of the most picturesque and challenging holes in the western Pennsylvania and eastern Ohio area.

### [Pine Grove Golf Course](http://www.pinegrovegolf.com/ "Pine Grove Golf Course")

38 Fairway Dr.

Grove City, PA 16127

[724.458.8394](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.458.8394 "Call with Dialpad")

Rated "four stars" by Golf Digest, this 18-hole layout offers variety and playability to golfers of all skill levels. With well-conditioned fairways and fast-rolling greens that wind through naturally wooded terrain and multiple water hazards, this is one golf experience worth the drive.

### [Bob O'Connor Golf Course](http://www.thebobgc.com/aboutus/ "Link to Bob O' Connor Golf Course"), Schenley Park

5370 Schenley Drive

Pittsburgh, PA 15217

[412-622-6959](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412-622-6959 "Call with Dialpad")

Located in Schenley Park, just minutes from downtown in Pittsburgh's Oakland neighborhood, Bob O'Conner Golf Course is the only course located within city limits. The beautiful 18-hole walking course is set with the rolling hills of the park and is open throughout the year, weather permitting. Otherwise, the course also offers three full-sized indoor simulators, reservations only.

### [Grand View Golf Club](http://www.pittsburghgolf.com/ "Link to Grand View Golf Club"), North Braddock

1000 Club House Drive

North Braddock, PA 15104

[412.351.5390](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412.351.5390 "Call with Dialpad")

Nicknamed the "Monster on the Mon," Grand View Golf Club sits on top of a mountain along the Monongahela River, one of the three rivers that form Pittsburgh's iconic confluence. Just minutes from downtown in Braddock, the course is full of hills and turns that are sure challenge golfers of all levels.

### [Meadowink Golf Course](http://www.meadowinkgolf.com/ "Link to Meadowink golf course website"), Murrysville

4076 Bulltown Road

Murrysville, Pa 15668

[724.327.8243](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.327.8243 "Call with Dialpad")

Just of the I-376 East, Meadowink Golf Course is located roughly forty minutes from Downtown. The 18-hole par 72 course layout is designed with strategically placed bunkers and water hazards.

### [Westwood Golf Club](http://westwoodlinks.net/ "Link to Westwood Golf Club website"), West Mifflin

825 Commonwealth Avenue

West Mifflin, PA 15122

[412.462.9555](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412.462.9555 "Call with Dialpad")

Located twenty minutes from downtown, Westwood Golf Club boasts 18 holes of championship golf. The strategic and convenient layout of the beautiful well-kept par 71 course offers the opportunity to play a full round of golf without spending an entire afternoon on the course.

### [Riverview Golf Course](http://riverviewpa.com/ "Link to Riverview Golf Course website"), Bunola

97 Golf Course Drive

Bunola, PA 15020

[412.384.7596](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412.384.7596 "Call with Dialpad")

Located roughly forty five minutes to an hour outside of Pittsburgh, Riverview Golf Course is an 18-hole course that spreads of 150 acres with tree lined fairways and tournament style greens.

### [Lindenwood Golf Club](http://www.lindenwoodgolf.com/ "Link to Lindenwood Golf Club website"), Canonsburg

360 Galley Road

Canonsburg, Pa

[724.745.9889](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.745.9889 "Call with Dialpad")

Located roughly twenty five minutes south of Downtown, Lindenwood Golf Club boasts a 27-hole championship layout. The beautiful rural backdrop is a great addition to the challenging yet enjoyable course.

### [3 Lakes Golf Course](http://www.3lakesgolf.com/ "Link to 3 Lakes Golf Course Website")

6700 Saltsburg Rd.

Pittsburgh, PA 15235

[412.793.7111](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412.793.7111 "Call with Dialpad") The well maintained course features undulating fairways, a variety of scenic holes, and firm, fast greens that will test your game. Come and play!

## Private Golf Courses

### [Mystic Rock at Nemacolin](http://www.nemacolingolf.com/)

1001 LaFayette Dr.

Farmington, PA 15437

[724.329.6455](http://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.329.6455 "Call with Dialpad")

Mystic Rock, designed by the legendary Pete Dye, can offer golfers a challenge unlike most others. The Par-72, 7,533-yard course has received top honors from Golf Magazine and Golf Digest. Mystic Rock has a 78.1 rating and 151 slope from the championship tees. The course has undergone extensive changes from its original design based on feedback from top PGA Tour players.

### [Shepherd’s Rock at Nemacolin](http://www.nemacolingolf.com/)

1001 LaFayette Dr.

Farmington, PA 15437

[724.329.6455](http://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.329.6455)

Shepherd's Rock is a 7,151-yard golf course that offers extraordinary golf in a unique setting. The course has a USGA rating and slope of 74.7/138 from the championship tees. The rolling bucolic terrain is ideal to fully utilize Dye's brilliant imagination in fashioning an outing that is both fun and challenging for golfers. The layout rivals the highest-rated golf courses in the country and is a perfect companion to Nemacolin's PGA TOUR tested Mystic Rock.

### [Edgewood Country Club](http://edgewood.memberstatements.com/tour/tours.cfm?tourid=2709 "Link to Edgewood Country Club website")

100 Churchill Road

Pittsburgh, PA 15235

Phone: [412.823.7300](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412.823.7300 "Call with Dialpad")

Established in 1898, Edgewood Country Club has earned the reputation of being a high-quality and family-oriented club. Only 15 minutes from Downtown, the Edgewood Country Club is the perfect location for business meetings, corporate events, golf outings, and more. Their Championship Golf Course, designed by Donald Ross, is a meticulously maintained, challenging, yet golfer-friendly course. The Clubhouse features swimming pools, tennis courts, paddle tennis courts, and banquet rooms for any event or occasion.

### [Southpointe Golf Club](http://www.southpointegolfclub.com/ "Southpointe Golf Club")

360 Southpointe Blvd.

Canonsburg, PA 15317

[724.746.2950](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.746.2950 "Call with Dialpad")

Great golf starts with great terrain. With an ideal Washington County location, Southpointe sets new standards of excellence. With multiple tee areas, plateau fairways and greens designed and maintained to USGA specifications, every hole has its own unique characteristics.

### [Diamond Run Golf Club](http://www.clubcorp.com/Clubs/Diamond-Run-Golf-Club "Diamond Run Golf Club")

132 Laurel Oak Dr.

Sewickley, PA 15143

[412.741.2020](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412.741.2020 "Call with Dialpad")

Diamond Run is a golfing haven for both the amateur and the seasoned golfer. Situated in the rolling hills of Sewickley, this 18-hole Gary Player Signature Course offers five sets of elevated tees per hole, beautiful views and 100 sand bunkers. From the first drive to the last putt, the course is designed for a player''s maximum enjoyment.

### [Oakmont Country Club](http://www.oakmont-countryclub.org/ "Oakmont Country Club")

1233 Hulton Rd.

Oakmont, PA 15139

[412.828.8000](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=412.828.8000 "Call with Dialpad")

Introduced in 1903 by designer Henry Fownes, Oakmont Country Club has hosted more major Championships than any other course in the U.S. With 180 deep bunkers (personified by the Church Pews), hard and slick greens that slope away from the player, and tight fairways requiring the utmost precision, Oakmont is one of the most difficult courses in North America.

### [Totteridge Golf Club](http://www.totteridge.com/ "Totteridge Golf Club")

325 Hannastown Rd.

Greensburg, PA 15061

[724.837.6700](https://dialpad.com/launch?phone=724.837.6700 "Call with Dialpad")

Totteridge Golf Club, on land south-east of Pittsburgh, was once part of a land grant from William Penn, founder of Pennsylvania. Totteridge is links-style layout that stretches from 5,483 to 7,368 yards while taking full advantage of the gently sloping hills and breathtaking scenery. The land itself contributes to multiple elevated tee boxes and natural fairway mounding. Even with selective bunkering and lightening fast greens, the course is well suited to all those who love the game.

## Authentic Experiences

U.S. Open 2025

Join fellow golf aficionados in welcoming the U.S. Open for the 10th time in Pittsburgh, where professional and amateur players compete in one of the major golf championships of the year.

[Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/events-festivals/annual-events/us-open/)

# Outdoor Adventure

The Ultimate Urban Excursion Awaits!

Golf, boat, bike and explore the outdoors in Pittsburgh

Wrapped in rivers, intertwined with trails and packed with parks, Pittsburgh is full of outdoor adventure. Bike, walk or rollerblade miles of riverfront trails, soaking in fantastic urban views. Bicycle rentals are available along the trail. Guided hikes offer another way to see the city. Rent a kayak and paddle your way along the river. Pittsburgh boasts a lush and diverse landscape and is filled with endless recreational opportunities for every outdoor enthusiast.

[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%27%20width%3D%271%27%20height%3D%271%27%20style%3D%27background%3Atransparent%27%2F%3E)](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/golf/)

Pennsylvania is home to more than 500 public [golf courses](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/golf/), with many of the best located in the Pittsburgh area. Enjoy championship play that is second to none.

[See More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/golf/)

[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%27%20width%3D%271%27%20height%3D%271%27%20style%3D%27background%3Atransparent%27%2F%3E)](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/fishing-boating/)

[See More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/fishing-boating/)

## Parks & Trails

Western Pennsylvania is home to some of the most diverse landscape in the U.S. On foot, by bike or in the water, the ways to experience [Pittsburgh and Allegheny County trails](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/trails/) and parks are endless. Hike, bike, hunt, fish or ride through the many beautiful [city, county and state parks](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/parks/) If your wanderlust reaches beyond the city limits, head off on the 150-mile Great Allegheny Passage, which begins at Pittsburgh's Point State Park, links with the C&O Canal Towpath in Maryland and then takes you all the way to the nation's capital for a spectacular 335-mile trail adventure! Take time to enjoy a detour on the [Montour Trail](http://www.montourtrail.org/ "Link to Montour Trail website") \- 60 miles of scenic pedestrian & bicycle rail-trail from Coraopolis on the Ohio River to Clairton on the Monongahela. Download the [Official Guide for Pennsylvania State Parks & Forests App](http://www.dcnr.state.pa.us/stayconnected/mobile-app/ "external link") for iPhone and Android before setting off on your visit to Pittsburgh and its countryside.

content:
# Things to Do

A City of Multitudes

Pittsburgh is a modern, ever-evolving city where the must-sees vary week to week as Downtown-encompassing [festivals](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/events-festivals/), a vibrant Cultural District of [world-class productions](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/arts-culture/), fan-friendly [sports events](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/pittsburgh-sports-teams/) in iconic stadiums, and our distinct [four seasons](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/plan-your-trip/weather/) make each trip unique. Add in our award-winning [culinary](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/restaurants-culinary/) scene, [craft beverage](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/restaurants-culinary/craft-breweries/)-packed neighborhoods and renowned [museums](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/arts-culture/museums/) you can enjoy throughout the year, and the only thing you won't have on your itinerary is free time.

Need to extend your trip a day or two to get it all in? [We figured](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/hotels-resorts/).

Inclines and trolleys and riverboats (oh my)! There are so many ways to [tour and sightsee](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/tours-sightseeing/) around the city of Pittsburgh.

You can take a [tour](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/tours-sightseeing/) by bike, trolley, boat, jet ski, kayak, funicular, bus or Segway, or go old fashioned and explore on your own two feet. Take a ride on the historic [Duquesne Incline](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/duquesne-incline/) for panoramic views of the city's skyline and rivers.

[Outdoor enthusiasts](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/) can hike, bike and picnic at the numerous [parks and green spaces](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/parks/), including [Schenley Park](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/schenley-park/) and [Point State Park](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/point-state-park/).

Our recommendation? Pick one of our [90 neighborhoods](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/neighborhoods/) that make the city unique and explore.

# Pittsburgh Pirates

Raise the Jolly Roger! Let's Go Bucs!

## Baseball in Pittsburgh

The best time to visit Pittsburgh is during baseball season, and an evening in Pittsburgh is best spent at one of the most popular ballparks in all of baseball, [PNC Park](https://www.mlb.com/pirates/ballpark). With downtown Pittsburgh serving as a scenic backdrop and a dramatic entry via the Roberto Clemente Bridge along the Allegheny River, you'll see why Pittsburghers and visitors love to [cheer for the Pittsburgh Pirates](http://www.mlb.com/pirates). ABC News, TripAdvisor, ESPN and more have named PNC Park as an ultimate site to catch a game with a spectacular view of the Downtown skyline.

And there is always great [food](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/blog/what-to-eat-at-pnc-park/), events, [promotions and giveaways](http://www.mlb.com/pirates/tickets/promotions/2022) during baseball season. Don't miss your chance to win t-shirts, hats, backpacks and bobble heads. You can have a front-row seat as you see the skyline light up on Fireworks Night, bring your dog to the ballpark on Pup Night every Tuesday, or stay after the game for a free concert on specific evenings.

While you are in town for a game, stop by the [Western Pennsylvania Sports Museum](http://heinzhistorycenter.org/sportsMuseum.aspx%22%20%5Ct%20%22_blank%22%20%5Co%20%22external%20link) or the [Clemente Museum](http://www.clementemuseum.com/) and relive some of the great moments of Pittsburgh sports history.

So round up your family and friends and make your way down to PNC Park to catch a game. Let’s Go Bucs!

title: Pittsburgh Trails | Hiking, Biking & Water Trails | Visit Pittsburgh
content:
[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%27%20width%3D%271%27%20height%3D%271%27%20style%3D%27background%3Atransparent%27%2F%3E)](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/family-fun/)

[Details](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/family-fun/)

[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%27%20width%3D%271%27%20height%3D%271%27%20style%3D%27background%3Atransparent%27%2F%3E)](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/fishing-boating/)

Pittsburgh sits at a unique confluence of rivers unlike any other in the world, diverse and more abundant than any other state except Alaska.

[Details](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/fishing-boating/)

# Trails

On foot, by bike or in the water, the ways to experience Pittsburgh and Allegheny County are endless.

Check out the extensive trail information below and begin your own outdoor urban adventure!

## Hiking Trails

There are [over 700 outdoor stairways](http://positivelypittsburgh.com/pittsburghs-city-steps/) within Pittsburgh's city limits, totaling 24,090 vertical feet. The highest concentration of city steps is in the [South Side Slopes neighborhood](http://www.southsideslopes.org/ "external link") which holds its annual [StepTrek](http://www.southsideslopes.org/steptrek/ "external link") event in October that allows walkers to climb the many steps in the slopes while benefiting step maintenance in the area. Many of these steps are considered part of the local transit system, and are a great way to start exploring the city on foot.

The [Allegheny County Parks](https://www.alleghenycounty.us/parks/index.aspx) offer over 180 miles of trails throughout the nine parks. Park visitors can download the [Allegheny County Parks Trails App](https://www.alleghenycounty.us/Parks-and-Events/Parks/Park-Maps) to easily choose which one to traverse by viewing its length, difficulty, and elevation profile. Visitors can also track their location and get current weather conditions. Our trails are friendly to hikers, bikers, horseback riders, and runners.

Take your exploration to the next level by delighting in the beauty of Pittsburgh and Allegheny County on one of the diverse hiking trails that stretch through 24 miles of the city. The [Three Rivers Heritage Trail System](http://friendsoftheriverfront.org/trails/three-rivers-heritage-trail/ "link to Three Rivers Heritage Trail information") is a 33-mile trail and greenway system that goes through Downtown Pittsburgh running along both sides of the Allegheny, Monongahela and Ohio Rivers. The trail connects Downtown to adjacent city areas including Oakland, the North Shore, the South Side and the Strip District.

Venture a little further into Allegheny County on the [Rachel Carson Trail](http://www.rachelcarsontrails.org/rct/ "external link") a 35.7-mile day-hike trail connecting [North Park](http://www.alleghenycounty.us/parks/npfac.aspx "external link") in central Allegheny County to [Harrison Hills County Park](http://www.alleghenycounty.us/parks/hhfac.aspx "external link") in its northeast corner. This diverse trail ranges from paved areas to rugged terrain and steep inclines.

## The Great Allegheny Passage

Get ready for the ride of your life as you bike the [Great Allegheny Passage](http://www.gaptrail.org/ "link to Great Allegheny Passage website"), 335 miles of adventure spreading across two states and the District of Columbia. The Great Allegheny Passage is one smooth ride stretching 150 miles from Cumberland, Md., through the Laurel Highlands and into Pittsburgh offering travelers fun on two wheels or two feet. Outdoor adventurers won't want to miss the scenic trail that [Livability.com](http://livability.com/topics/experiences-adventures/hopping-on-americas-rails-to-trails-movement/ "link to Livability.com") acclaimed as one of the best and longest multipurpose trails in the East.

In Cumberland, the GAP joins the 185-mile C&O Canal Towpath creating a 335-mile continuous trail experience to Washington, D.C. These nearly-level trails bring adventurers into the heart of the majestic western Pennsylvania, Maryland and West Virginia wilderness as they travel through [charming trail towns](http://www.trailtowns.org/) and near National Landmarks such as famed architect [Frank Lloyd Wright's Fallingwater](http://www.fallingwater.org/ "external link").

Explore the trail on your own or with a group, [Golden Triangle Bike Rental](http://www.bikepittsburgh.com/ "external link") is your one-stop-shop for all things GAP. Their services range from "fully-equipped" bike rental packages to shuttle service to [trip planning and fully-supported tours](http://www.gap-outfitters.com/ "external link"). Whether you are pedaling out 5 miles or riding all the way to/from D.C., check in with Golden Triangle for everything you need to make your adventure on the GAP a success

## Biking Trails

Pittsburgh's unique topographic blend of steep, winding hills and flat river areas makes it one of the best cities for cycling enthusiasts. Looking for an urban cycling adventure? Check out the [Eliza Furnace Trail](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/golden-triangle-bike-bicycle-tours-trails/), a part of the larger [Three Rivers Heritage Trail](http://www.friendsoftheriverfront.org/ "external link") that runs through the city and offers many [bike rack sites](http://bikepgh.org/resources/bike-parking/#Where? "link to list of bike racks on Bike Pittsburgh website") for easy storage as you explore one of the many unique neighborhoods along the trail. Need a lift to your next trail? Pittsburgh's bike friendly public transit operator the [Port Authority](http://www.portauthority.org/ "external link") allows riders many options to store their bikes while taking a ride to their next destination.

Perhaps you crave a more scenic route - with a ride that winds through 19 miles of Pittsburgh Steel history - along the Steel Valley section of the [Great Allegheny Passage](http://www.atatrail.org/ "link to Great Allegheny Passage Trail website"), the 335-mile trail connecting Washington, D.C., to Pittsburgh. Mountain bikers, be sure to check out the [Pittsburgh Off-Road Cyclists](http://www.porcmtbclub.org/ "external link") for more information on great trails and Pittsburgh''s thriving mountain bike community.

If you forgot the bike at home, Golden Triangle Bike has it covered with bike rentals and maps to take you across the city or along the Great Allegheny Passage.

## Water Trails

Pittsburgh sits at a unique confluence of rivers unlike any other in the world, and its diversity is more abundant than any other state except Alaska. The [three rivers](http://www.friendsoftheriverfront.org/ "external link") that meet in Pittsburgh are actually a vast watershed of more than a dozen unique creeks and river systems that include more than 30,000 miles of rivers and streams extending into New York and West Virginia. These clean and accessible waters have become a stunning icon of Pittsburgh's environmental transformation and allow you to experience the city from a new vantage point. [Kayak Pittsburgh](http://www.kayakpittsburgh.org/ "external link") lets you paddle down the [Allegheny River](http://www.friendsoftheriverfront.org/ "external link") and take in the city sites of Downtown and the North Shore from the water. Row up one of the United States'' only North flowing rivers, the [Monongahela](http://www.friendsoftheriverfront.org/ "external link") with [Three Rivers Rowing](http://www.threeriversrowing.org/ "external link") which offers Free Learn to Row and Paddle Days.

Spend an afternoon boating from one of the seventeen marinas in Allegheny County along the three rivers, offering river access, dining and boat maintenance. Station Square on the South Shore offers public docks at Bessemer Court, for easy river access to downtown shopping and dining. Also within the city limits are four [public boat launches](http://www.lrp.usace.army.mil/Portals/72/docs/Recreation/BOAT%20LAUNCHING%20RAMPS.pdf "external link"), one on the Monongahela River in the South Side and three along the Allegheny River. Pittsburgh's 38.3 miles of river shoreline within the city limits offers ample space for fishing and western Pennsylvania's [state parks](http://www.dcnr.state.pa.us/stateparks/ "external link") abound with well-stocked lakes and streams.

Adventurers are sure to stop by [Ohiopyle State Park](http://www.dcnr.state.pa.us/stateparks/findapark/ohiopyle/ "link to Ohiopyle State Park information"), where the Youghiogheny River boasts class III and IV rapids and is considered to be some of the best whitewater in the east. Check out [White Water Adventurers](http://www.wwaraft.com/ "external link") and [Laurel Highlands River Tours](http://www.laurelhighlands.com/ "external link") for more information on the rapids.

## Local Trail Organizations & Outdoors Clubs

[Allegheny Trail Alliance](http://www.gaptrail.org/ "Allegheny Trail Alliance") The Great Allegheny Passage rail-trail offers 150 miles of hiking and biking between Cumberland, Md. and Pittsburgh. IN Cumberland, the GAP joins the C&O Canal Towpath, creating a continuous trail experience, 335 miles long to Washington, D.C.

[DCNR Rails to Trails Guide](http://www.explorepatrails.com/ "DCNR Rails to Trails Guide") Pennsylvania Department of Conservation and Natural Resources information on trails proposed, open and under construction.

[Friends of the Riverfront](http://www.friendsoftheriverfront.org/ "Friends of the Riverfront") Increases awareness and engagement with the Pittsburgh region’s rivers and riverfronts through activities, stewardship and expansion of water and land trails.

[Rachel Carson Trails Conservancy](http://www.rachelcarsontrails.org/ "Rachel Carson Trails Conservancy") A nonprofit, volunteer-based organization dedicated to the development, protection and promotion of hiking, biking and walking trails throughout western Pennsylvania.

[Allegheny Outdoor Club](http://www.alleghenyoutdoorclub.org/ "Allegheny Outdoor Club") An organization based in northwestern Pennsylvania that maintains a weekly schedule of hosted hiking, biking, winter skiing activities and special events.

[Explorers Club of Pittsburgh](http://www.pittecp.org/ "Explorers Club of Pittsburgh") Founded in 1947, the club is devoted to outdoor exploration and adventure in the western Pennsylvania region. Members participate in activities as diverse as mountaineering, [rock climbing](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/blog/rock-climbing/), skiing, scuba diving, canoeing, kayaking, caving, cycling, backpacking, environmental and community service projects, and a host of outdoor sports.

Keystone Ramblers

Local organization that maintains a schedule of hikes arranged into different themed series.

[Venture Outdoors](http://www.ventureoutdoors.org/ "Venture Outdoors") A nonprofit organization devoted to increasing participation in outdoor recreational activity through sponsorship of biking, hiking, kayaking, fishing, climbing, nature observation and skiing in the western Pennsylvania region.

When you're enjoying outdoor activities, always remember to be safe. The [Outdoor Safety Health Guide](http://www.safehome.org/resources/outdoor-safety-health-guide/) is a great way to enjoy the outdoors safely!

## Authentic Experiences

# Things to Do

A City of Multitudes

Pittsburgh is a modern, ever-evolving city where the must-sees vary week to week as Downtown-encompassing [festivals](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/events-festivals/), a vibrant Cultural District of [world-class productions](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/arts-culture/), fan-friendly [sports events](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/pittsburgh-sports-teams/) in iconic stadiums, and our distinct [four seasons](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/plan-your-trip/weather/) make each trip unique. Add in our award-winning [culinary](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/restaurants-culinary/) scene, [craft beverage](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/restaurants-culinary/craft-breweries/)-packed neighborhoods and renowned [museums](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/arts-culture/museums/) you can enjoy throughout the year, and the only thing you won't have on your itinerary is free time.

Need to extend your trip a day or two to get it all in? [We figured](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/hotels-resorts/).

[Top Free Things to Do in Pittsburgh​Who said you have to spend money to have a good time?\\
Learn More](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/free-things-to-do/)

Inclines and trolleys and riverboats (oh my)! There are so many ways to [tour and sightsee](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/tours-sightseeing/) around the city of Pittsburgh.

You can take a [tour](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/tours-sightseeing/) by bike, trolley, boat, jet ski, kayak, funicular, bus or Segway, or go old fashioned and explore on your own two feet. Take a ride on the historic [Duquesne Incline](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/duquesne-incline/) for panoramic views of the city's skyline and rivers.

[Outdoor enthusiasts](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/) can hike, bike and picnic at the numerous [parks and green spaces](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/things-to-do/outdoor-adventure/parks/), including [Schenley Park](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/schenley-park/) and [Point State Park](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/directory/point-state-park/).

Our recommendation? Pick one of our [90 neighborhoods](https://www.visitpittsburgh.com/neighborhoods/) that make the city unique and explore.
